title: Trivia Tycoon: $z$-Scores and Proportions
question_text:
Mark is a beast when it comes to trivia. In the game Trivia Tycoon the number of points that players have accumulated is approximately normally distributed.
If Mark's $z$-score for points is $2.75$, what proportion of Trivia Tycoon players have accumulated fewer points than Mark?
solution:
The $z$-table identifies the proportion of observations in a normal distribution that will fall below a given $z$-score. Find the $z$-score of $2.75$ by looking down the first column until you see $2.7$.

Then follow across this row until it intersects with the column labeled $0.05$. Together this represents a $z$-score of $2.75$. The entry at this intersection ($0.9970$) is the proportion of observations that will fall below $z = 2.75$.

Choice 'D' is the correct answer.

It can be easy to capture an incorrect value when looking at the z-table. Be careful.
